intro: Scrophularia bahorucana, commonly known as the Madagascar scrophularia, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae, which includes various species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It produces clusters of tubular or bell-shaped flowers, often in shades of pink or purple. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in ecological and horticultural contexts.
